channel.title: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?
channel.description:
this is very strange. You need mage lvl 99 to wear mage cape and 99 range to wear range cape but the others you can wear without that you need lvl 99.
I dont know how i can and i couldnt find anything where i can see the id of the range/mage cape. i know the id but i cant find in anywhere
does someone know how i can chanse the rest of the skillcapes till 99 towhere i need to search ect.
thanx already
btw i use silab's client.

item.title: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?
item.dc:creator: @anuslikker anuslikker
item.description:
@anuslikker wrote:

It wont work :S i dont understand i got everywere already:

if (ItemName.startsWith("Magic Cape")) { return 99; } return 1; }
and with range ig ot this:

if (ItemName.startsWith("Range Cape")) { return 99; } if (ItemName.startsWith("Dark Bow")) { return 99; } if (ItemName.startsWith("Crystal")) { return 80; } if (ItemName.startsWith("Seercull")) { return 70; } if (ItemID == 2497) { return 70; } return 1; }
only that 2 work :S

Read full topic
item.source: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?

item.title: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?
item.dc:creator: @pker4lifeXD pker4lifeXD
item.description:
@pker4lifeXD wrote:

the bad part is that there are the combat skills but usually in getclhitpoints for example most servers dont have that coded in for firemaking etc because it is not noramlly used so u would have to add them urself.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?

item.title: How can I chanse skillcape wearing stat?
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

[quote=“D D 3, post:2, topic:175786”]It’s in the client.java search for the id or search for woodcutting or range.Like in some servers it looks like this for capes.

if (ItemName.startsWith(“Strength Cape”)) {
return 99;
The return 99 is the skill so try that to find these codes search a void like this.

public int GetCLStrength(int ItemID) {

or

public int GetCLDefence(int ItemID) {[/quote]

That may not always work, you need to add a boolean that will reject the id of the cape, if you are under level 99.

Read full topic
